headline.main: SELECTEE IS SEIZED AS A GERMAN SPY; Soldier Serving as Typist at Governors Island Is Sixth to Be Linked With Ring

lead_paragraph: A soldier assigned to typing official documents at Fort Jay, Governors Island, was arrested yesterday as the sixth person involved in a Nazi spy ring that allegedly specialized in assembling military information for Chancellor Hitler. The suspect, Rene Charles Froehlieh, was drafted into the Army last February by Local Board 175, Brooklyn, despite his open connection with a Nazi propaganda agency at that time.
abstract: R C Froehlich, Transocean News Service ex-employe and present official document typist at Fort Jay, held on charge of aiding Ludwig; Kennedy and Sebold testify on Lang's link with Norden bombsight and espionage
